meanings.definition: A wedge or other object used to keep a door open.
meanings.sent1: I used a doorstop to hold the door open while I carried the groceries inside.
meanings.sent2: The doorstop was made of rubber and had a bright color to easily spot it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the doorstop was a toy and kept batting it around.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a doorstop, always there to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent5: The doorstop's role was crucial during the party, ensuring the door stayed open for guests.

meanings.definition: A heavy object placed against a door to prevent it from closing.
meanings.sent1: The security guard placed a doorstop to keep the door from closing during the event.
meanings.sent2: The doorstop was a large brick that effectively blocked the door from shutting.
meanings.sent3: The doorstop was so heavy that even the strongest wind couldn't move it.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like a doorstop, preventing any obstacles from closing his path.
meanings.sent5: The doorstop's presence was reassuring, ensuring no one accidentally got locked out.
